metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46872 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An attacker who compromised a content process could have partially escaped the sandbox to read arbitrary files via clipboard-related IPC messages.
*This bug only affects Thunderbird for Linux. Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 108, Firefox ESR < 102.6, and Thunderbird < 102.6. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46872` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
